title: Not the best not the worst
review: I like Pacino's previous work in godfather. Did not completely believe his casting. A pure mafia violence fest which can be fun when you're in the mood

title: The actual best
review: One of brad pitt's finest. Ed Norton was odd casting for the time but he pulls this psychological thriller off well with some quirky and shocking moments

title: Unpretentious
review: A film that laughs at itself as you laugh with it. Yet it invokes emotions of joy, fear and sadness all in one.

title: Mindless fun
review: Silly acting but a great classic that I love watching during the Christmas break

title: Total A list
review: Honestly the best A list film of its time. Lots of bad Cop flicks out there. This film pioneered the genre. Great acting and a non stop roller coaster

title: Pure fun
review: While the acting is a bit hit and miss, this film still kept me laughing and cringing the whole time. Brad Pitt is a standout

title: Enjoyable
review: Was weird watching braff in this role after scrubs and I do feel he juggled too many hats and faultering for it. His characterization could have been better. Otherwise an enjoyable film

title: Great
review: If you love martial arts as much as I do and hot women weilding swords, this film is for you! The soundtrack is awesome

movie_title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
title: Average
review: Very similar to the original. Not the best sequel but still watchable

title: Mindless violence
review: Tarantino could have done better. There's some heavy scenes here that were gratuitous without propelling the plot. Seemed like a reason to put A listers in a room together. Still- it's a genre I like so I watched it.

title: Great animated film
review: This film is where Pixar-style films made their dent in history. A modern day lion king that hasn't been bested so many years on
